description: Weekly ideas, insights, and tips on management from Harvard Business Review.
title: The HBR Channel

episodes.title: How to Be Ready for a Layoff
episodes.description: It never hurts to be prepared for the worst. Especially when it comes to losing your job.

episodes.title: How the Myth of Meritocracy Divided the U.S.
episodes.description: One week after a contentious U.S. election, we speak with Harvard political philosopher Michael J. Sandel about making sense of what’s happening in America.

episodes.title: Leading Through Polarizing Times
episodes.description: On election day in the U.S. we talked with Harvard Business School's Frances X. Frei to discuss how we can best navigate the emotional and personal challenges of this moment.

episodes.title: What’s the Point of LinkedIn, Anyway?
episodes.description: It’s the least fun social platform, but the most important for your career. Here’s how to make LinkedIn work for you.

episodes.title: Moderna’s Co-Founder on the Sprint for a Covid-19 Vaccine
episodes.description: Moderna could seek government approval for its Covid-19 vaccine as early as November.

episodes.title: How Industry Competition Theory Can Help Fix U.S. Politics
episodes.description: Unhealthy competition is at the root of political dysfunction. A famous business framework can help identify the best ways to fix it.

episodes.title: Can History’s Innovators Teach Us How to Survive 2020?
episodes.description: When we look back at 2020, what will we have learned after a global health crisis, a national reckoning around racism, and a divisive election?

episodes.title: How to Deal with Remote Conflict
episodes.description: Disagreements between work colleagues can get even more uncomfortable and tricky to navigate when you can’t work them out in person.

episodes.title: How to Say No at Work
episodes.description: You may have wondered how to say no to a not-so-great request from your boss. Here’s how.

episodes.title: How Cubicles, Telecommuting, Personal Computers, and Email Changed the Way We Work
episodes.description: Can a brief history of the modern office help us understand changes happening today?

episodes.title: How Will the Covid-19 Crisis Reshape International Relations?
episodes.description: Which country is responding best to the global crisis, and is the era of globalization dead?

episodes.title: How to Reinvent Yourself and Your Career in the Wake of the Covid-19 Crisis
episodes.description: How will the crisis affect the career paths of today's workforce. What are the new opportunities, and how can you write your own script for success?

episodes.title: I Tried Three Popular Productivity Methods and This is What I Learned
episodes.description: There’s a huge amount of productivity systems and time management strategies out there. But what actually works, and why?

episodes.title: Coping with Anxiety and Uncertainty at Work
episodes.description: We often try to push away stress, fear, and anxiety. But success doesn't depend on rejecting these emotions — we can thrive because of them.

episodes.title: How to Build Your Mental Strength
episodes.description: First, realize there’s a difference between acting tough and actually being mentally strong.

episodes.title: How to (Really) Diversify Your Workforce
episodes.description: Why do many companies fail to create and sustain diverse workforces, even when they make it a priority?

episodes.title: How to Speak Up in Meetings
episodes.description: The meeting is almost over and you’ve been too nervous to say anything. We feel you. Here’s what to do.

episodes.title: How to Make Virtual Meetings Feel More Real
episodes.description: Even though we can’t be physically together during the pandemic, is it possible to communicate more effectively through the grid like haze of video chats and virtual meetings?

episodes.title: The Race for a Covid-19 Vaccine
episodes.description: The CEO of Pfizer says his company is working to get a vaccine to the masses as quickly as possible — including those in disadvantaged and vulnerable communities.

episodes.title: Democracy Is in Trouble. Business Must Help Fix It.
episodes.description: Strengthening democracy is the only way to ensure the survival of free-market capitalism.

episodes.title: Dr. Anthony Fauci on What It Will Take to Beat the Pandemic
episodes.description: The U.S. is still dealing with the first wave of Covid-19, he says.

episodes.title: The Outlook for Global Business
episodes.description: When will we see economic recovery?

episodes.title: How to Answer the Question, “Tell Me About Yourself”
episodes.description: It may seem like a softball, but it's actually the toughest job interview question. Here's how to nail it.

episodes.title: During Covid-19 Crisis, Leaders Must Resist Urge to Push Too Hard, Too Fast
episodes.description: Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi CEO, Dr. Rakesh Suri, says the first step in leading his team was to slow down, take a deep breath, and align his team with a shared vision for action.

episodes.title: What Leaders Must Do Today to Address Systemic Racism
episodes.description: How do we start real conversations about race in our organizations?

episodes.title: Understanding the Economic Shock of the Covid-19 Crisis
episodes.description: Predicting the path ahead has become nearly impossible, but we can speculate about the size and scale of the economic shock.

episodes.title: Finding Post-Pandemic Meaning With Arianna Huffington
episodes.description: How can we best take care of ourselves while we get through this pandemic? And how can we set ourselves up to thrive afterward?

episodes.title: Find Your Grit in a Crisis
episodes.description: Angela Duckworth, bestselling author of “Grit: The Power of Passion and Perseverance”, explains how to stay resilient in the face of the Covid-19 crisis.

episodes.title: How and When Will We Get Back to Work?
episodes.description: What’s the right way to reopen the U.S. for business? How do we balance safety and the need to get the economy going?

episodes.title: How to Actually Work...When You’re Working from Home
episodes.description: Because boundaries are fuzzy, you could either burn out or not get anything done.

episodes.title: Quick Study: How to Stop Promoting Incompetent Men
episodes.description: Are there fewer women in management because we can’t discern between confidence and competence?

episodes.title: Quick Study: How to Fire with Compassion
episodes.description: Firing needs to be handled well: the person you’re firing today could become a key contact or client tomorrow.

episodes.title: Quick Study: How and When to Disrupt Your Career, and Yourself
episodes.description: If you’re comfortable but bored at your current position, you’re in the danger zone. Here are some ways to keep growing without leaving your company.

episodes.title: Should You Sell Your Startup, or Find a New CEO? (Case Study)
episodes.description: Should a small company founder facing stalling growth sell to a competitor or hire a new CEO?

episodes.title: Quick Study: The High Cost of Being a Working Mom in the U.S.
episodes.description: Government intervention is needed, but managers can take these steps right now.

episodes.title: The Explainer: The Case for More Silent Meetings
episodes.description: Talking meetings have much merit, but can also be subject to a host of problems.

episodes.title: The Explainer: The Case for More Silent Meetings
episodes.description: Talking meetings have much merit, but can also be subject to a host of problems.

episodes.title: The Explainer: The Case for More Silent Meetings
episodes.description: Talking meetings have much merit, but can also be subject to a host of problems.

episodes.title: Quick Study: Stopping Yourself from Acting On Bad Impulses
episodes.description: It’s about training yourself to pause. Here's how.

episodes.title: Quick Study: How to Make It as a Power Couple
episodes.description: Three challenges every successful couple must overcome.

episodes.title: When Will We Reach Gender Equality?
episodes.description: Ten years? Fifty? Business students take their best guesses, and Melinda Gates explains why the real number is centuries away.

episodes.title: The Explainer: 4 Signs That Masculinity Contests Are Holding Back Your Company
episodes.description: For example, extreme hours are a badge of honor.

episodes.title: The Explainer: 4 Signs That Masculinity Contests Are Holding Back Your Company
episodes.description: For example, extreme hours are a badge of honor.

episodes.title: Storytelling With Data: A Good Charts Workbook Tool
episodes.description: Scott Berinato, author of Good Charts and Good Charts Workbook, explains how storytelling with data is as simple as setup, conflict, and resolution.

episodes.title: 3 Questions to Answer in an Apology
episodes.description: Trust is not as fragile as people think — it can be rebuilt. And that process starts with a good apology.

episodes.title: How Does Marvel Studios Balance Continuity and Renewal?
episodes.description: In just a decade Marvel Studios has redefined the franchise movie. Their secret seems to be finding the right balance between creating innovative films and retaining enough continuity to make them all recognizably part of a coherent family.

episodes.title: Using Improv to Unite Your Team
episodes.description: This behavioral scientist has spent her career studying team communication. But an improv comedy class taught her a lot about teamwork.

episodes.title: Expanding the Pool of Job Candidates
episodes.description: Goldman Sachs is using asynchronous video interviews to reach a broader swath of job candidates.

episodes.title: Wrong Thinking: Solve Problems in New Ways
episodes.description: To come up with a great idea, sometimes it helps to start with a bad one.

episodes.title: Facing Your Mid-Career Crisis
episodes.description: Philosophers ancient and modern offer tools for thinking through the shape of our careers and the attitudes we take toward them.

episodes.title: Undercover Boss: A Fictionalized Case Study
episodes.description: An airline boss goes undercover to gather ideas for speeding up the cleaning of planes in between flights. Watch the video and let us know what you’d do.

episodes.title: The Explainer: Balancing Two Types of Company Performance
episodes.description: Most organizations only focus on one.

episodes.title: Whiteboard Session: Every Business Is a Software Business
episodes.description: Five ways to manage your company like a software business.

episodes.title: The Authenticity Paradox
episodes.description: Learn how leaders can develop an "adaptively authentic" style in this video slide deck. Download a customizable version here.

episodes.title: Whiteboard Session: How Does Blockchain Work?
episodes.description: The power of a distributed ledger.

episodes.title: The Explainer: How to Write a Great Business Plan
episodes.description: A business plan that asks -- and answers -- the right questions is a powerful tool.

episodes.title: How and When Selflessness at Work Backfires
episodes.description: Generosity burnout, explained.

episodes.title: The Benefits Employees Want Don't Always Cost a Lot
episodes.description: Work-life balance and flexibility rank highly.

episodes.title: What Great Managers Do
episodes.description: Exceptional managers find and capitalize on their employees' unique strengths. Learn how they do it with this 6 minute video slide deck. Download a customizable version in Subscriber Exclusives.

episodes.title: How Non-English-Speaking Countries Stack Up on English Proficiency
episodes.description: It's the language of international business.

episodes.description: A two-minute guide to one of the most important types of data analysis.

episodes.description: Make the competition irrelevant.

episodes.description: Based on a survey of 250 B2B salespeople.

episodes.description: Investors prefer companies with less stuff.

episodes.description: Women are quicker to adjust their self-image.

episodes.description: What does your company do better than any other firm?

episodes.description: Identify what works for your specific needs.

episodes.description: Seven characteristics. Take the survey to see how your company compares.
